properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 13 at 7:31PM CST until February 15 at 10:30AM CST by NWS Huntsville AL
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama...

Big Nance Creek at Courtland affecting Lawrence County

The Flood Warning continues for
the Big Nance Creek at Courtland
* until Saturday morning.
* At 6 PM Thursday the stage was 17.5 feet and rising.
* Flood Stage is 14.0 feet.
* Moderate Flooding is occurring and Moderate Flooding is forecast.
* Recent activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at
6 PM Thursday was 17.5 feet.
* Forecast...The river will continue rising to near 18.0 feet by
after midnight tonight. The river will fall below Flood Stage early
Saturday morning.
* Impact...At 20.0 feet...Water is approaching homes south of downtown
Courtland...with several streets impassible. Water reaches the
underside of the bridge at Old Highway 20 in Courtland.
* Flood history...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.2 feet
on Dec 24 2019.
properties.instruction:
Safety message...Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to
recognize flood dangers. If while driving you see water over a road,
turn around, don't drown! The water depth may be too great to allow
your vehicle to cross. Additional information is available at
http://water.weather.gov. Once there, click on the Tennessee Valley
to view local river information.
